sub_topic: Using integration to find the work done by a force
message_1: A 50-kg box is being pulled up a ramp with an incline of 30 degrees. The force needed to pull the box up the ramp is 300 N, and the ramp is 6 meters long. Using integration, find the work done by the force in pulling the box up the ramp.
message_2:
To find the work done by the force in pulling the box up the ramp, we can use the formula:

Work = ∫ F(x) dx

where F(x) is the force applied along the ramp and x is the distance along the ramp. In this case, the force is constant at 300 N, so the integral becomes:

Work = ∫ (300) dx from 0 to 6

Now, we can integrate:

Work = 300x | from 0 to 6

Evaluate the integral at the limits:

Work = 300(6) - 300(0)
Work = 1800 - 0
Work = 1800 J

So, the work done by the force in pulling the box up the ramp is 1800 Joules.
